trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Audit Report Events
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Audit Report Events

trans-unit.source: Audited events that are available for viewing and downloading from your Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Audited events that are available for viewing and downloading from your Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Audit Report Events
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Audit Report Events

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory Audit Report helps customers identify privileged actions that occurred in their Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory Audit Report helps customers identify privileged actions that occurred in their Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Privileged actions include elevation changes (for example, role creation or password resets), changing policy configurations (for example password policies), or changes to directory configuration (for example, changes to domain federation settings).
trans-unit.target: Privileged actions include elevation changes (for example, role creation or password resets), changing policy configurations (for example password policies), or changes to directory configuration (for example, changes to domain federation settings).

trans-unit.source: The reports provide the audit record for the event name, the actor who performed the action, the target resource affected by the change, and the date and time (in UTC).
trans-unit.target: The reports provide the audit record for the event name, the actor who performed the action, the target resource affected by the change, and the date and time (in UTC).

trans-unit.source: Customers are able to retrieve the list of audit events for their Azure Active Directory via the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/), as described in [View your access and usage reports](active-directory-view-access-usage-reports.md).
trans-unit.target: Customers are able to retrieve the list of audit events for their Azure Active Directory via the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/), as described in [View your access and usage reports](active-directory-view-access-usage-reports.md).

trans-unit.source: Events in the Azure AD Audit report are retained for 180 days.
trans-unit.target: Events in the Azure AD Audit report are retained for 180 days.

trans-unit.source: For more information about retention on reports, see [Azure Active Directory Report Retention Policies](active-directory-reporting-retention.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about retention on reports, see [Azure Active Directory Report Retention Policies](active-directory-reporting-retention.md).

trans-unit.source: For customers interested in storing their audit events for longer retention periods, the Reporting API can be used to regularly pull audit events into a separate data store.
trans-unit.target: For customers interested in storing their audit events for longer retention periods, the Reporting API can be used to regularly pull audit events into a separate data store.

trans-unit.source: See [Getting Started with the Reporting API](active-directory-reporting-api-getting-started.md) for details.
trans-unit.target: See [Getting Started with the Reporting API](active-directory-reporting-api-getting-started.md) for details.

trans-unit.source: Properties included with each audit event
trans-unit.target: Properties included with each audit event

trans-unit.source: The date and time that the audit event occured
trans-unit.target: The date and time that the audit event occured

trans-unit.source: The user or service principal that performed the action
trans-unit.target: The user or service principal that performed the action

trans-unit.source: The user or service principal that the action was performed on
trans-unit.target: The user or service principal that the action was performed on

trans-unit.source: Added a user to the directory.
trans-unit.target: Added a user to the directory.

trans-unit.source: Deleted a user from the directory.
trans-unit.target: Deleted a user from the directory.

trans-unit.source: Set the license properties for a user in the directory.
trans-unit.target: Set the license properties for a user in the directory.

trans-unit.source: Reset the password for a user in the directory.
trans-unit.target: Reset the password for a user in the directory.

trans-unit.source: Changed the password for a user in the directory.
trans-unit.target: Changed the password for a user in the directory.

trans-unit.source: Changed the license assigned to a user in the directory.
trans-unit.target: Changed the license assigned to a user in the directory.

trans-unit.source: Updated a user in the directory.
trans-unit.target: Updated a user in the directory.

trans-unit.source: Added a user to a directory role.
trans-unit.target: Added a user to a directory role.

trans-unit.source: Removed a user from a directory role.
trans-unit.target: Removed a user from a directory role.

trans-unit.source: This includes email addresses for marketing, as well as technical notifications about Microsoft Online Services.
trans-unit.target: This includes email addresses for marketing, as well as technical notifications about Microsoft Online Services.

trans-unit.source: Added a partner to the directory.
trans-unit.target: Added a partner to the directory.

trans-unit.source: Removed a partner from the directory.
trans-unit.target: Removed a partner from the directory.

trans-unit.source: Added a service principal to the directory.
trans-unit.target: Added a service principal to the directory.

trans-unit.source: Removed a service principal from the directory.
trans-unit.target: Removed a service principal from the directory.

trans-unit.source: Added credentials to a service principal.
trans-unit.target: Added credentials to a service principal.

trans-unit.source: Removed credentials from a service principal.
trans-unit.target: Removed credentials from a service principal.

trans-unit.source: Added a domain to the directory.
trans-unit.target: Added a domain to the directory.

trans-unit.source: Removed a domain from the directory.
trans-unit.target: Removed a domain from the directory.

trans-unit.source: Updated a domain on the directory.
trans-unit.target: Updated a domain on the directory.

trans-unit.source: Changed the default domain setting for the company
trans-unit.target: Changed the default domain setting for the company

trans-unit.source: Updated the federation settings for a domain.
trans-unit.target: Updated the federation settings for a domain.

trans-unit.source: Verified a domain on the directory.
trans-unit.target: Verified a domain on the directory.

trans-unit.source: Verified a domain on the directory using email verification.
trans-unit.target: Verified a domain on the directory using email verification.

trans-unit.source: Added a delegation entry to the directory.
trans-unit.target: Added a delegation entry to the directory.

trans-unit.source: Update a delegation entry in the directory.
trans-unit.target: Update a delegation entry in the directory.

trans-unit.source: Removed a delegation entry from the directory.
trans-unit.target: Removed a delegation entry from the directory.

trans-unit.source: Set the property that enables a directory for Azure AD Sync.
trans-unit.target: Set the property that enables a directory for Azure AD Sync.

trans-unit.source: Set length and character constraints for user passwords.
trans-unit.target: Set length and character constraints for user passwords.

trans-unit.source: See the [Get-MsolCompanyInformation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn194126.aspx) PowerShell cmdlet for more details.
trans-unit.target: See the [Get-MsolCompanyInformation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn194126.aspx) PowerShell cmdlet for more details.

trans-unit.source: Set the property that forces a user to change their password on login.
trans-unit.target: Set the property that forces a user to change their password on login.

trans-unit.source: User attributes included in the Update User audit event
trans-unit.target: User attributes included in the Update User audit event

trans-unit.source: The "Update user" audit event includes additional information about what user attributes were updated.
trans-unit.target: The "Update user" audit event includes additional information about what user attributes were updated.

trans-unit.source: For each attribute, both the previous value and the new value is included.
trans-unit.target: For each attribute, both the previous value and the new value is included.

trans-unit.source: The user is allowed to sign in.
trans-unit.target: The user is allowed to sign in.

trans-unit.source: All licenses that have been assigned to the user.
trans-unit.target: All licenses that have been assigned to the user.

trans-unit.source: Service plans resulting from the licenses assigned to the user.
trans-unit.target: Service plans resulting from the licenses assigned to the user.

trans-unit.source: Details on licenses assigned to the user.
trans-unit.target: Details on licenses assigned to the user.

trans-unit.source: For instance, if group-based licensing was involved, this would include the group that granted the license.
trans-unit.target: For instance, if group-based licensing was involved, this would include the group that granted the license.

trans-unit.source: A list of verification methods configured by the user for Multi-Factor Authentication, such as Voice Call, SMS, or Verification code from a mobile app.
trans-unit.target: A list of verification methods configured by the user for Multi-Factor Authentication, such as Voice Call, SMS, or Verification code from a mobile app.

trans-unit.source: If Multi-Factor Authentication is enforced, enabled, or disabled for this user.
trans-unit.target: If Multi-Factor Authentication is enforced, enabled, or disabled for this user.

trans-unit.source: The user’s phone number, alternative phone number and email address used for Multi-Factor Authentication and password reset verification.
trans-unit.target: The user’s phone number, alternative phone number and email address used for Multi-Factor Authentication and password reset verification.

trans-unit.source: Audit records are a required control for many compliance regulations.
trans-unit.target: Audit records are a required control for many compliance regulations.

trans-unit.source: For customers using the Azure Active Directory Audit Report to meet their compliance regulations, it is recommended that the customer submit a copy of this help topic with the copy of the customer’s exported audit report to help explain the report details.
trans-unit.target: For customers using the Azure Active Directory Audit Report to meet their compliance regulations, it is recommended that the customer submit a copy of this help topic with the copy of the customer’s exported audit report to help explain the report details.

trans-unit.source: If the auditor would like to understand the compliance regulations that Azure currently meets, direct the auditor to the [Compliance page](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/trust-center/compliance/) of the Microsoft Azure Trust Center.
trans-unit.target: If the auditor would like to understand the compliance regulations that Azure currently meets, direct the auditor to the [Compliance page](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/trust-center/compliance/) of the Microsoft Azure Trust Center.
